stars.name: Sirius
stars.description: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky and belongs to the constellation Canis Major (the Great Dog).

stars.name: Adhara
stars.description: Adhara is the second-brightest star in the Canis Major constellation.

stars.name: Wezen
stars.description: Wezen is a bright star in Canis Major, known for its yellow-white appearance.

stars.name: Murzim
stars.description: Murzim is a blue-white star located in Canis Major.

stars.name: Aludra
stars.description: Aludra is a blue-white supergiant star in Canis Major.

stars.name: Rigel
stars.description: Rigel is a blue-white supergiant star and the brightest in the constellation Orion.

stars.name: Bellatrix
stars.description: Bellatrix is a blue-white giant star located in Orion's left shoulder.

stars.name: Mintaka
stars.description: Mintaka is one of the stars in Orion's belt and has a blue appearance.

stars.name: Saiph
stars.description: Saiph is a blue-white supergiant star in Orion's right knee.

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.description: Betelgeuse is a red supergiant star in the constellation Orion. It is one of the brightest stars in the night sky.

stars.name: Proxima Centauri
stars.description: Proxima Centauri is the closest known star to the Sun and is part of the Alpha Centauri star system.

stars.name: Alpha Centauri A
stars.description: Alpha Centauri A is one of the three stars in the Alpha Centauri star system and is similar to our Sun.

stars.name: Alpha Centauri B
stars.description: Alpha Centauri B is another star in the Alpha Centauri star system, slightly cooler and dimmer than Alpha Centauri A.

stars.name: Alpha Centauri C (Proxima Centauri)
stars.description: Alpha Centauri C is also known as Proxima Centauri, the closest star to our Solar System.

stars.name: Beta Centauri
stars.description: Beta Centauri is the second-brightest star in the Centaurus constellation.

stars.name: Polaris
stars.description: Polaris, also known as the North Star, is a bright star close to the north celestial pole.

stars.name: Kochab
stars.description: Kochab is one of the two outer stars forming the bowl of the Little Dipper in Ursa Minor.

stars.name: Pherkad
stars.description: Pherkad is the other outer star forming the bowl of the Little Dipper in Ursa Minor.

stars.name: Yildun
stars.description: Yildun is a white subgiant star located in the constellation Ursa Minor.

stars.name: Kocab
stars.description: Kocab is the brighter of the two stars forming the bowl of the Little Dipper's bowl.

stars.name: Vega
stars.description: Vega is the brightest star in the constellation Lyra and is known for its bluish-white color.

stars.name: Sheliak
stars.description: Sheliak is a binary star in the constellation Lyra, forming a pair with Sulafat.

stars.name: Sulafat
stars.description: Sulafat is another binary star in Lyra and is part of the Sheliak-Sulafat system.

stars.name: Alathfar
stars.description: Alathfar is a bright star in Lyra, known for its blue color and its role in the Summer Triangle asterism.

stars.name: Theta Lyrae
stars.description: Theta Lyrae is a binary star system in the constellation Lyra.

stars.name: Aldebaran
stars.description: Aldebaran is a prominent star in the constellation Taurus and is often called the 'Eye of the Bull.'

stars.name: Elnath
stars.description: Elnath is a blue-white star marking the tip of one of the Bull's horns in Taurus.

stars.name: Alcyone
stars.description: Alcyone is one of the stars in the Pleiades star cluster and is part of Taurus.

stars.name: Pleiades (Seven Sisters)
stars.description: The Pleiades is an open star cluster within the Taurus constellation, known as the Seven Sisters.

stars.name: Ain
stars.description: Ain is a white star located in the Taurus constellation.

stars.name: Antares
stars.description: Antares is a red supergiant star and the brightest in the constellation Scorpius.
